body:
The [USEARCH download request form](https://www.drive5.com/usearch/download.html) generates a unique download for every request of the software, embedding the requestors email address into the binary.  For example:

```
./usearch10.0.240_i86linux32
usearch v10.0.240_i86linux32, 4.0Gb RAM (32.9Gb total), 8 cores
(C) Copyright 2013-17 Robert C. Edgar, all rights reserved.
http://drive5.com/usearch

License: user@example.com
```

If initiating the download from a "trusted source," do I just use `--no-checksum` to bypass the check if installing it as an explicit package?

If not explicitly installed, how can I bypass the checksum of a dependency without ignoring checksums for the entire package?
title: USEARCH md5sum issue with unique downloads
